item.description:
Cockaponset is the second largest forest in the Connecticut state forest system, encompassing over 16,000 acres of land.  Parts of the Cockaponset trail system were developed in the 1930′s by the Civilian Conservation Corps. Much of their grading and stonework is still in place today.

Cockaponset was an Indian chief who was buried in the Ponset section of Haddam (near where our hike begins).

 

HIKE PLAN

TRAIL MAPS:  Cockaponset State Forest - North trail map (1st loop); Cockaponset State Forest - South (2nd loop)

HIKE RATING:  Terrain (easy, average, strenuous, very strenuous); Expected Pace (slower, moderate, fast [2-2.5mi/hr], very fast); Overall Difficulty: (introductory, easy, intermediate, advanced, expert)

DISTANCE (approx): 1st loop: 3.6mi, 2nd loop: 1.6mi

ELAPSED TIME: 2.5hr (approx)

ELEVATION GAIN (APPROX): TBD

General description: Two-part looping hike starting/ending at the commuter parking lot near Exit 8, CT-9.  We will hike both loops for a total of 5.2mi unless there is sufficient interest in hiking only the first loop.

HIKE START TIME: Feet will hit the trail promptly at 10:30am, so please aim to be at the parking lot no later than 10:15am.

HIKE LOGISTICS: We will congregate in the commuter parking area - Look for me holding a Hartford Area Hiking (TM) Meetup sign.  We will then walk carefully West along Beaver Meadow Road approx 0.2mi to the trailhead.

 

Those who wish to go should have:

* A daypack or lumbar pack - To carry trail food, water, and any extra items

* At least 2 quart (2 liter) drinking water

* Hiking boots advised

* Bug spray advised (to repel ticks and other pesky insects; see this publication for discussion of tick and insect repellents)

 

DRIVING DIRECTIONS: Take Exit 8 from CT-9 to Beaver Meadow Road.  Turn left onto Beaver Meadow Road and look for the commuter parking lot.

LATITUDE/LONGITUDE OF PARKING AREA: 41.45607, -72.52874

Problems finding the parking lot? Call Kevin H at 860-373-0836

 

Check out the DEP web site for more information.

 

== Legal Stuff ===

By clicking on "Count Me In" or "Yes" for this event you agree, warrant, and covenant as follows: In consideration for accepting this entry, I, the registrant, intending to be legally bound, hereby, for myself, my heirs, my executors and administrators, do waive and release any and all rights for damages I may have against any parties or persons connected with the Hartford Area Hiking (TM) Meetup group for and related to the above listed event. I attest and verify that I am physically fit to participate in any portion of this above listed event. I grant Hartford Area Hiking (TM) permission to use any photographs, film or videotapes of this event for any purpose.

==================
item.how_to_find_us: we'll meet in the commuter parking lot - I'll be holding a Hartford Area Hiking (TM) Meetup sign

group.name: The Hartford Area Hiking™ Meetup Group
